intro: Chaetocarpus domingensis, commonly known as the "Domingo's sea fennel," is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils near the shore, often growing in brackish or saltwater environments. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, peppery scent when crushed. Chaetocarpus domingensis is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for digestive and respiratory ailments.
